title: Morocco’s Distance Education Reform and Blended Learning Strategy Design

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Analyzing Morocco’s education reform case studies to explore digital transformation challenges and solutions, developing actionable strategies for blended learning environments

learning_goals: Analyze key obstacles and success cases of Morocco's remote education reform from a structural perspective.

Within four weeks, learners analyze three or more digital infrastructures (learning management systems, video production tools, real-time collaboration platforms) required for blended learning environments and write a project report proposing priority-based improvements within institutional budget constraints.

Based on the digital competency diagnostic results of both instructors and learners, learners can design a customized educational program utilizing at least three digital tools (e.g., Google Workspace, LMS, AI tutors) within four weeks and submit a practical report meeting at least four out of five peer-assessment rubric criteria.

resources: Case Study Report on Moroccan Educational Reform Initiatives
Comparative Analysis of Digital Learning Tools

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
